title: compiler panic on "let v[0] = v[1]" where v is a vector

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

body:
<short summary of the bug>
I was playing with rust for the first time today and I tried this code:
<code sample that causes the bug>

```
fn main(){
    let mut v = vec![5, 6, 5, 4, 3, 2];
    let tmp = v[0];
    let v[0] = v[1];
    let v[1] = tmp;
}
```

 <explanation>
In retrospect that shouldn't compile anyway, but when I tried instead of it just being an error the compiler panics.
## Meta
